intro: Cynometra pedicellata, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It is valued for its hard, heavy wood used in furniture and cabinetry. The tree also plays an important role in traditional medicine and local ecosystems.
